description: installed it went to look for it. Couldn't find it. found log files for it and all they said was something about profiles being changed, doesn't work for me. Don't like things that hide and then find logs about actions taken. Fix your program or take it off.
I've been using this app on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and removable media and no problems to report.The GUI is straight forward.
summary: This app worked great for me!

description: Tried this as a duplicate files finder since fslint is currently broken in the Ubuntu 20.04 LTS repository. FIrst off it doesn't show up in my apps so I had to launch from terminal. then it can't read anything above my home directory so there goes trying to read mounted drives. This should not be in the Snap store. I'll just do it myself.
Not able to find the installed app and run it

I also found it installed but disappeared, not in programs menu. If you type czkawka into terminal it starts, think they forgot to code for a menu entry. 
It took an age to download and install as well. 
(KDE-Neon 5.21)

Has a few papercut-issues (like no .desktop file provided so you have to start it from the command line) but it's generally very well thought out. Also, the developer is very fast to respond when posting issues on GitHub. Hope this app keeps making progress and turn into *the* goto file de-dup tool!
Maybe an option to choose number of number of cpus. Many thanks for your effort. Installing not difficult.
summary: Works fine, a little slow when lots of files

description: It won't access external disks even after enabling permission. This make it useless.
Straightforward UI, finds duplicates amazingly quickly under a variety of categories. Really helped me find and eliminate dozens of picture duplicates.
It struggles with large directories (1 million files) but this is expected.
When it doesn't include a setting to allow access to most of the file-system
summary: less than useful as a snap

description: New to Linux and running Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS. I did not experience any of the concerns other users experienced. After installing from the Snap Store a shortcut was readily available in my Application list. By default I did notice that the app did not have access to my mounted media. I found it incredibly easy to modify permissions in the Applications section of Ubuntu Settings so the app had access to my mounted media.
summary: Works great for me. Thank you

description: difficult to use it I prefer Fslint
doesnt work on Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS 64Bit
No soy experto pero funcionó de forma aceptable luego de instalar el paquete gtk-3-demo
No es capaz de trabajar con el formato de imagen WEBP
El snap no permite trabajar con ffmpeg para buscar duplicidad en videos. Esperamos que lo implementen en futuras releases.
pas d'acces aux periferiques usb malgre la ligne de commande, dommage...
fonctionne très bien, y compris avec les disques externes

si vous avez installé le snap, il faut ajouter la commande :
sudo snap connect czkawka:removable-media
 pour lire les disques externes
